overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students represent and solve a real-world problem using a decreasing exponential function. They analyze a Worked Example demonstrating how to solve an exponential equation using common bases and then use this method to solve several exponential equations. Students compare characteristics of pairs of exponential functions represented in different forms.

overview_item_data_items: I can write exponential equations to represent situations, tables, and graphs.
I can represent exponential equations using common bases.
I can compare exponential equations represented in different ways, such as tables, graphs, equations, and verbal descriptions.
I can interpret parts of an exponential function in real-world situations.
You can use multiple representations such as tables, equations, and graphs to represent situational equations.
You can use Properties of Powers to rewrite numeric and algebraic expressions involving integer exponents.
Use common bases and properties of exponents to solve simple exponential equations.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students compare exponential and linear growth patterns in real-world situations.
Students investigate a problem situation represented by a decreasing exponential function and write exponential functions given tables and a graph.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Using Common Bases to Solve Exponential Equations
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students solve exponential equations using the common bases method.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Comparing Exponential Functions in Different Representations
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students compare characteristics of pairs of exponential functions represented as tables, graphs, and equations.
Students use rational exponents and radical notation to rewrite expressions.

overview_item_data_items: If facilitating this lesson without student devices, no additional materials are needed.
To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
